relation: Hang out between classes, join clubs, and become a part of Greek Life.
Lots of places to eat around the campus and there is a small store on campus as well as vending machines all over.
I have not looked at the dorms and won't be living in them so I don't know what to say about that. But from what I've heard, they are very nice.
I haven't attended a class yet so I can't really attest a lot to whether the classes are very challenging or not.

Check out the university before applying and see if the small campus is for you, it doesn't seem very small once you're actually on campus though, and the few times I've been there, I forget I'm in Turlock.
There seem to be many places to spend between classes on campus, and my classes are all in one building this semester so that should be nice.

The professors are there when you need them and are always willing to help. Since this is a small school the student to faulty ratio is 21:1.}

textAfterTable: Bertha from Santa Ana, CA 01/16/2011 Reviewer is A current student here. 8 out of 8 people found this review useful. 2 of 82 Categories Comments Great for these types of students If you really want to just get out and want a new scene or if you want a peaceful small school its perfect. Tips for prospective students Come check out the campus see it you like it. Once you've decided to come here make sure to get involved on campus it opens so many doors. If you can I highly advise doing Student Leadership Program during the summer you'll meet so many new people. Also make sure you go to as many events at school because all the events we put together it's for the students and you're paying for it through ur student fees so get your moneys worth by going. Bang for the buck Since the school is very small it's as if your paying the price of a public school but the quality of a private school. The school
